channel.title: My HTML and CSS template
channel.description:
Alright, so I've actually taken a day or so on this rather than an hour or so as I normally do. I'm starting off with html and CSS and hopefully moving into PHP and so forth.
http://halounreachable.com/beta/
I'm hoping that we're mature enough here to realize that I'm not advertising for the intention of attracting users, considering the site isn't even finished. I just figure that I can get better criticism by posting the full page here.
I'm open for anything other than the color change and top and left nav. That's the layout I want, so I'm keeping it. Anything from buttons to gradients, I'm open for change. It's my first actual attempt at a template, so take the effort it into consideration ;).
BTW! Don't judge the source code for the html page right away. I know it's sloppy, and I'm going to revise it. I just did it quickly so I could get the concept.

item.title: My HTML and CSS template
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

[quote=“cane, post:4, topic:344942”]Why have you got 2 navigation bars?[/quote]Exactly.

WowILikeToCode:

In my opinion instead of the navigation bar going along the top you should add a tag and have something like recent news.

Yeah, and for any important headlines, you can use
then you can go and use a marquee in status bar and page title using javascript. And be sure to fill page with animated gifs.
Oh wait, nvm… it isn’t 1997 any more…

Read full topic

item.title: My HTML and CSS template
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

WowILikeToCode:

In my opinion instead of the navigation bar going along the top you should add a tag and have something like recent news. It would just stop the whole idea of having 2 navigational bars and make the site more user friendly. You should also shift the banner right because it currently hides behind the navbar, This is easily done using margins

wtf no, marquee is retarded. just remove the whole bar.

Read full topic

In my opinion instead of the navigation bar going along the top you should add a tag and have something like recent news. It would just stop the whole idea of having 2 navigational bars and make the site more user friendly. You should also shift the banner right because it currently hides behind the navbar, This is easily done using margins

item.title: My HTML and CSS template
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You really should validate it and fix any errors before posting about it:
http://validator.w3.org/check?uri=http%3A%2F%2Fhalounreachable.com%2Fbeta%2F&charset=(detect+automatically)&doctype=Inline&group=0

Most of them are trivial and can be fixed by adding an encoding and doctype to the page, and a few alt tags for the images, but small stuff like that matters a lot, depending on the browser used.

Read full topic

item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Tribey, post:2, topic:344942”]The actual concept of the layout is good, look’s a little bit justified, as in, thing’s are quite spaced apart, and there’s huge spaces needed to be filled (I know it’s not finished). Also, that stupid ad box pops up every 15 seconds.[/quote]Oh, yeah I know about the ad. Sorry, it’s the shit host (ulmb). I plan on putting a lot more detail into empty space in order to make it more approachable lol.
